The Flemish government is planning to invest more than eight billion euros into the restoration of its national art museum. The proposal, which will be presented to the public in January 2021, will involve the construction of several new buildings in the capital, Flanders. The government established the Flemish National Museum (Fremde Kunstmuseum) in 2008 following a merger of two former management companies, the private museum company HOK and the state-run organization ERF. The museum now boasts eighty-three works by seventy-eight artists.
